title: Universe
text: The key profile area Dynamics of the Universe of the University of Cologne coordinates research between different disciplines of astrophysics (observations, instrument development, theory & simulation, laboratory astrophysics), applied mathematics and computer science, digital humanities, and geophysics. One particular aim is to establish a new research area Astroinformatics at the University. A main part of the key profile area is the new cluster of excellence DynaVerse together with University Bonn, the Max Planck Institute for Radio Astronomy, the German Aerospace Center, and the Heidelberg Institute for Theoretical Studies. DynaVerse launched in January 2026.

title: Trixi User and Developer Interaction (TRUDI) 2026
text:
16‚Äì20 March 2026 ‚Ä¢ Cologne, Germany



TRUDI 2026 is a workshop bringing together users and developers of the Trixi Framework, which includes the Julia packages Trixi.jl, TrixiShallowWater.jl, TrixiAtmo.jl, and TrixiParticles.jl. The program will feature talks, tutorials, and hackathons aimed at consolidating the existing community, aligning long-term strategy, and advancing key features in high-performance scientific computing.


 


Trixi.jl


adaptive high-order CFD




 


TrixiShallowWater.jl


SWE applications




 


TrixiAtmo.jl


atmospheric flow




 


TrixiParticles.jl


particle-based multiphysics




In addition to the main Trixi Framework packages, we rely on - and actively collaborate with - a broader ecosystem of upstream dependencies and partner projects maintained by members of our community, including (but not limited to):

HOHQMesh ¬∑ HOHQMesh.jl
libtrixi
p4est ¬∑ P4est.jl
PointNeighbors.jl
StartUpDG.jl
SummationByPartsOperators.jl
t8code ¬∑ T8code.jl
Trixi2Vtk.jl
TrixiBottomTopography.jl
TrixiLW.jl

The event is co-hosted by SNuBIC, the DFG research unit on ‚ÄúStructure-preserving Numerical Methods for Bulk and Interface-Coupling of Heterogeneous Models‚Äù (FOR5409). We gratefully acknowledge further support by the key profile area Dynamics of the Universe of the University of Cologne.

title: Program
text:
The workshop will take place at the Mathematical Institute of the University of Cologne (see Venue for directions). All scheduled talks and organized sessions will be held in the main room Cohn-Vossen (room 313). Adjacent to it, Seminarraum 3 (room 314) will serve as the catering area for lunch and coffee breaks and as an informal workspace for discussions and small-group collaboration, particularly during free or hacking sessions.
There are four types of contributions: plenary talks, contributed talks, one idea talks, and hands-on sessions:
In addition, each afternoon there is an open session to interact and collaborate with other TRUDIs. These slots can be freely used for, e.g., small meetings, coding sessions, or spontaneous science heurekas.

title: SNuBIC
text: SNuBIC (short title for Structure-preserving Numerical Methods for Bulk and Interface-Coupling of Heterogeneous Models) is a team of researchers funded by the German Research Foundation under the grant number DFG-FOR5409 to investigate the modeling and simulation of coupled systems described by partial differential equations (PDEs). While the development of accurate numerical methods for various types of PDEs is still a very active research field, most complex applications are described by coupled systems of several PDEs, i.e.¬†by heterogeneous models, like magnetised plasmas, complex fluids and electro-chemical processes. Key aspects of our research unit are bulk- and interface-coupling, structure-preserving numerical methods, and re-usable code development.

title: Venue
text:
TRUDI 2026 will take place at the Mathematical Institute of the University of Cologne, Germany.
All scheduled talks and organized sessions will be held in the main room Cohn-Vossen (room 313). Adjacent to it, Seminarraum 3 (room 314) will serve as the catering area for lunch and coffee breaks and as an informal workspace for discussions and small-group collaboration, particularly during free or hacking sessions.
